summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors and investigators discussing case strategy. It covers scheduling a meeting with two sisters who may have information about Jeffrey Epstein, and issuing a subpoena to publicist R. Couri Hay based on his public statements about conversations with Epstein.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: A publicist who had conversations with Jeffrey Epstein about rehabilitating his image; prosecutors are seeking to subpoena him for information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; discussed in relation to his attempts to improve his public reputation and his admissions about his conduct.

connections.description: Hay was consulted by Epstein for public relations strategy regarding his image rehabilitation.

events.title: Interview with Town & Country
events.description: R. Couri Hay gives an interview to Town & Country magazine where he discusses having strategy conversations with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduling of victim attorney meeting
events.description: Prosecutors schedule a meeting with a victim attorney for 6 PM.

events.title: Request to contact sisters
events.description: Prosecutors request to set up a meeting with two sisters who previously worked with Epstein and may have information or been victims.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are seeking to interview two sisters who previously worked with Jeffrey Epstein and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein or his associates.
Publicist R. Couri Hay is a target for a subpoena after giving media interviews about conversations with Epstein regarding image rehabilitation.
In the referenced media report, Epstein told Hay that his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia, and the girls were 'tweens and teens'.
The email chain indicates active investigation and witness outreach by the Southern District of New York in July 2019.
Multiple investigators and attorneys are coordinating on interviews and subpoenas for the case.
